title: Smart Grama Sustainability Platform - Government Digital Services System

requirements.text: Implement user authentication system with two roles (Citizen and Admin) supporting registration, login, and JWT-based session management with role-based access control
acceptanceCriteria: Citizens can register with name, email, and password
Admin users can log in with secure credentials
JWT tokens are generated and validated on protected routes
Role-based routing prevents citizens from accessing admin pages
Password hashing is implemented for secure storage

requirements.text: Create Complaint Reporting Module allowing citizens to submit complaints with name, mobile, category (Garbage, Street Light, Drainage, Others), description, photo upload, audio upload, auto geo-location capture, and status tracking
acceptanceCriteria: Citizens can submit complaints with all required fields
Photo and audio files are uploaded and stored
Geo-location is automatically captured and stored with latitude and longitude
Complaints display status badges (Pending, In Progress, Completed)
Each complaint is associated with the submitting user

requirements.text: Build admin complaint management interface allowing Panchayat admins to view all submissions, filter by category, update status (Pending to In Progress to Completed), assign worker names, and upload completion proof photos
acceptanceCriteria: Admin dashboard displays all complaints in a list or card view
Filter functionality works for Garbage, Street Light, Drainage, and Others categories
Admin can change complaint status through a dropdown or button interface
Admin can assign worker name to complaints
Admin can upload completion proof photo
Status changes are reflected in real-time for citizens

requirements.text: Implement citizen complaint rating system allowing users to rate completed work after admin marks complaint as completed
acceptanceCriteria: Rating interface appears only when complaint status is Completed
Citizens can submit a rating (1-5 stars or similar scale)
Ratings are stored with the complaint record
Admin can view complaint ratings

requirements.text: Create Tree Plantation Module allowing citizens to request saplings, select tree type (Neem, Mango, etc.), upload planting photo, and geo-tag location
acceptanceCriteria: Citizens can submit tree plantation requests with tree type selection
Photo upload for planting proof is functional
Geo-location is captured and stored with each tree request
Tree type dropdown includes at least Neem, Mango, and other common varieties
Requests are stored with user association

requirements.text: Build admin tree plantation management allowing admins to approve requests, mark trees as planted, update survival tracking status, and view survival rate analytics
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can approve or reject tree plantation requests
Admin can mark trees as planted with date tracking
Admin can update survival status (Surviving/Dead)
Survival rate percentage is calculated and displayed
Dashboard shows total trees planted and survival rate

requirements.text: Implement Rainwater Harvesting (Inkudu Gunta) Module allowing citizens to request implementation with house details and land photo upload
acceptanceCriteria: Citizens can submit rainwater harvesting requests
Form collects house details (address, owner name, etc.)
Land photo upload is functional
Requests are stored with user association

requirements.text: Create admin rainwater harvesting management allowing admins to assign 100-days workers, track completion, mark water capacity, and add groundwater impact analytics
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can assign worker name to rainwater harvesting projects
Admin can update completion status
Admin can record water capacity measurement
Groundwater impact metrics are displayed on dashboard
Total rainwater projects count is tracked

requirements.text: Build Solar Scheme Application Module integrated with Pradhan Mantri Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana, allowing citizens to upload Aadhaar, electricity bill, house photo, and submit applications

quotes: Pradhan Mantri Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana

acceptanceCriteria: Citizens can upload Aadhaar document
Citizens can upload electricity bill
Citizens can upload house photo
Application submission is functional
All documents are stored securely
Applications are associated with users

requirements.text: Implement admin solar scheme management allowing admins to verify documents, update installation status, and track renewable energy generated with CO₂ reduction estimates
acceptanceCriteria: Admin can review uploaded documents
Admin can update installation status (Pending, Approved, Installed)
Admin can record energy generation data
Dashboard displays total homes installed
CO₂ reduction estimate is calculated and displayed
Energy generation metrics are visible

requirements.text: Create comprehensive Admin Analytics Dashboard displaying total complaints, completion percentage, tree survival rate, solar installations count, rainwater projects count, with bar chart, pie chart, monthly activity line chart, map with markers, and recent activity feed
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays key metrics: total complaints, completion rate, tree survival rate, solar installations, rainwater projects
Bar chart visualizes data comparison across categories
Pie chart shows distribution of complaint categories or status
Monthly activity line chart tracks trends over time
Map displays markers for complaints, trees, and solar installations
Recent activity feed shows latest submissions and updates

requirements.text: Integrate Google Maps displaying complaints as red markers, trees as green markers, solar homes as yellow markers, with filter by category functionality and popup details on marker click
acceptanceCriteria: Map displays all complaints with red markers at geo-tagged locations
Map displays all trees with green markers at geo-tagged locations
Map displays all solar installations with yellow markers at geo-tagged locations
Filter controls allow showing/hiding markers by category
Clicking a marker opens popup with relevant details (description, status, worker, etc.)
Map is responsive and works on mobile devices

requirements.text: Design government-style UI with header displaying India emblem style logo and village name, navbar with Home, Report Issue, Tree, Water, Solar, My Requests, Admin Login links, language toggle for English and Telugu, status badges with color coding, and clean white, saffron, and green theme that is fully mobile responsive

quotes: Header with India emblem style logo
Navbar: Home, Report Issue, Tree, Water, Solar, My Requests, Admin Login

acceptanceCriteria: Header includes India emblem style logo and village name prominently displayed
Navigation menu includes all specified sections
Language toggle switches between English and Telugu text
Status badges use distinct colors (e.g., yellow for Pending, blue for In Progress, green for Completed)
Color scheme uses white, saffron (#FF9933), and green (#138808) appropriately
Layout is fully responsive with mobile-friendly navigation
Card-based layout works well on all screen sizes
Buttons are touch-friendly on mobile devices

requirements.text: Implement My Requests page for citizens showing all their submitted complaints, tree requests, rainwater requests, and solar applications with status tracking
acceptanceCriteria: Page displays all user-submitted complaints with current status
Page displays all tree plantation requests with current status
Page displays all rainwater harvesting requests with current status
Page displays all solar scheme applications with current status
Each item shows submission date, category/type, and status
Users can view details of their past submissions

requirements.text: Create Government Schemes Information Page displaying all India government schemes with clickable scheme cards that navigate to detailed information pages showing full scheme details

quotes: add all the government schemas in india with there information when click the schema get the information about them in another page

acceptanceCriteria: Page displays grid or list of government scheme cards
Each scheme card shows scheme name and brief description
Clicking a scheme navigates to a dedicated detail page
Detail page shows comprehensive scheme information (eligibility, benefits, application process, contact details)
Scheme data is stored in backend and dynamically loaded
Include major schemes like PM Awas Yojana, PM Kisan, Ayushman Bharat, etc.

requirements.text: Add footer section with Panchayat office address, contact number, government disclaimer, and links to Privacy Policy, Terms of Service, and About Smart Grama pages

quotes: Footer with: Panchayat office address, Contact number, Government disclaimer

acceptanceCriteria: Footer displays on all pages
Footer includes Panchayat office address
Footer includes contact phone number
Footer includes government disclaimer text
Footer links to Privacy Policy page
Footer links to Terms of Service page
Footer links to About Smart Grama page
All linked pages have appropriate content

requirements.text: Implement backend data models for Users (with name, email, password, role), Complaints (with userId, category, description, photo, audio, location, status, assignedWorker, completionProof, rating), Trees (with userId, type, location, plantedDate, survivalStatus), SolarApplications (with userId, aadhaarDoc, billDoc, housePhoto, status), and WaterProjects (with userId, landPhoto, workerAssigned, completionStatus)

quotes: Complaints: userId, category, description, photo, audio, location { lat, lng }, status, assignedWorker, completionProof, rating
Trees: userId, type, location, plantedDate, survivalStatus
SolarApplications: userId, aadhaarDoc, billDoc, housePhoto, status

acceptanceCriteria: User model stores name, email, hashed password, and role
Complaint model includes all specified fields with proper data types
Location field stores latitude and longitude
Tree model tracks plantation details and survival status
SolarApplication model stores document references and status
WaterProject model tracks worker assignment and completion
All models have proper relationships (userId references User)
Models support CRUD operations through API endpoints

constraints: Backend must use only Motoko (not Node.js, Express, MongoDB, or Firebase)
Frontend must use React with TypeScript and Tailwind CSS
No external databases (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Firebase) - use Internet Computer's stable memory
No third-party authentication services (Auth0, Firebase Auth) - implement custom JWT or use Internet Identity
No WebSocket/Socket.io for real-time features - use Internet Computer's update calls
No external cloud storage (Cloudinary, Firebase Storage) - store files on-chain or use Internet Computer storage
Google Maps API integration is not directly supported - use alternative mapping solutions or static map generation
Audio upload features may need to be adapted for on-chain storage constraints
nonGoals: AI features for auto-categorization, priority detection, or survival risk prediction
Deployment to Vercel, Netlify, Render, or Railway
MongoDB Atlas or Firebase Firestore integration
